data.value: Elder, I'm afraid I have bad news. We've found Kier, but he was ambushed by Gaius' soldiers. He didn't stand a chance.

Then it has already begun. Dust, we are nearly out of time. Please, help Sanjin get our camp's support systems working once again. Without them, we will stand little chance of mounting an effective defense.
Mithrarin, do you need anything else?
Thank you, Elder, but I must be on my way.
Yes, much to do, less and less time to do it. Good luck.

There is also the matter of our scout, Kier. He has not checked in for many hours, but with our battle preparations we have not been able to mobilize a proper search party. His patrol takes him east of our camp, if you aim to find him.
Well, I'm here now, is there anything I can do to help?
We are spread a little thin. Our chief engineer, Sanjin, is having trouble with our camp's support systems. Go and speak with him when you can, and I'm sure he will explain further.
What kinds of weapons are we talking about?
Arrows made of light, machines that take to the sky like birds...
I see all sorts of lamps here, but no fire. Is this the Way of the Flameless Light?
It is, yes. In ancient times, the Moonbloods went by another name. We lived in a great society called the Cynthak, and we wielded the knowledge to follow the Way of the Flameless Light.
Settle in, Dust. This could take a while.
We Cynthak harnessed a power unlike any this world had ever seen. We built elaborate contraptions like these lamps, capable of piercing the darkness without so much as a spark.
Well, obviously something went wrong because we still have to build a fire every time Dust pulls out his map.

Unfortunately, the ancient tomes do not say how the Cynthak fell. That knowledge has been lost - perhaps intentionally. All we know is that our kind were made as outcasts, and that has remained true for countless generations.
For the longest time, we believed the Moonbloods were the only ones left who know of the Way of the Flameless Light... but we were wrong.

When General Gaius began his purge, there were stories of their weapons, stories of elaborate contraptions that seemed to defy the natural world. Weapons that sound identical to those of the Cynthak in the most of ancient of tales.
And we're supposed to fight these things with your... lamps?
Nobody ever does.
I did not say it would be easy.
Yeah, and you were WRONG.
I did, once, remember?
Not long, I'm afraid. The whole purpose of Gaius' campaign is to wipe us from the face of this world. Once he knows of our final stronghold, he will send everything he has... and destroy us.
Does General Gaius know of this place?
What? How!?
I fear he does now.
Aha! I knew that creepy merchant was one of you guys!
One of our own has been keeping an eye on you since your travels began. A merchant, Sereth.

He is a smart businessman. Deals in all the right places. Gaius' soldiers turned their gaze from him, in exchange for free goods. However, no amount of bribery could cover up that Sereth was helping you to find us.
How did a Moonblood operate so freely in the wildlands?
And that's how Gaius found out. How much time do you think we have to prepare?
How do you expect to win with so few soldiers?
We cannot. That's why we created Sen-Mithrarin. You, Dust, will turn the tide.
Surely you have more soldiers than this...
General Gaius is nothing if not thorough. His forces have exterminated most Moonbloods from this land. We are all that's left.
Aaah, well. No pressure or anything.
Yeah...
We welcome your presence, Sen-Mithrarin. Preparations for war are nearly complete.
Thank you Dust. I believe we are as prepared as we possibly could be. With the enemy at our gates, we have no choice but to begin our assault.
It sounds like Sanjin was able to get the pumps and generators working again.
Our warriors are gathering at the edge of the camp, waiting for you to lead them. Take this Yellow Resonance Gem, Dust. Use it to open the gate.
No doubt thanks to your help. With power and water flowing through our camp once again, we will be better equipped to handle our enemies in battle and properly tend to our wounded.
Thank you, Elder. For everything.
Whatever happens, Sen-Mithrarin, know that I am honored to have stood before you. The Moonbloods will follow you unto death. Now go. And Dust... good luck.

data.name: 000_Option_4
data.value: I need to get moving.

data.name: 000_Option_2
data.value: What is "The Way of the Flameless Light"?

data.name: 000_Option_3
data.value: What can I do to help?

data.name: 000_Option_0
data.value: Is this all you have left?

data.name: 000_Option_1
data.value: Are we safe here?
